metadata.title: Week 1 Day 2: Introduction to Latin Alphabet

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of the concept of alphabets and their role in language. Familiarity with the English alphabet will aid in recognizing similarities and differences with the Latin alphabet. Understanding the importance of discipline in learning new languages is also beneficial.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we introduced the concept of the Latin alphabet and began exploring its pronunciation. We also discussed the virtue of discipline and its importance in language learning.

primary: Students will recognize and pronounce the Latin alphabet.
Students will understand the importance of discipline in language learning.
Students will learn the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance.
Students will begin to build a basic Latin vocabulary.

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet introduced yesterday.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet with the teacher.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce new vocabulary words and their pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students listen and repeat new vocabulary words.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use flashcards to visually reinforce learning.

lesson_flow.description: Practice the pronunciation of the Latin alphabet and new vocabulary.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students practice in pairs, taking turns to pronounce words.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide feedback and correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students reflect on the phrase and its meaning.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the virtue of discipline.

lesson_flow.description: Summarize the day's learning and reinforce the importance of discipline.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students share one thing they learned today.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to apply discipline in their study habits.

behavior.loop_behavior: Gently redirect focus to the task
